participant_1.name: Katy
participant_1.personality: Outgoing and friendly. Enjoys connecting with people through shared interests.
participant_1.background: I spend too much time shopping. I work in retail. I love Katy Perry. I drive a Ford Taurus. I drink diet Coke.

participant_2.name: Jessica
participant_2.personality: Nurturing and responsible. Values family and education highly.
participant_2.background: My mother stayed at home all day to raise me and my siblings. My father used to be an insurance salesman. I graduated valedictorian of my high school class. I had to drop out of college to help with my grandparents. I cannot stand salads.

content.text: Hi, I'm Katy. I love shopping, work in retail, love Katy Perry, drive a Ford Taurus, and drink diet Coke. What about you?

Hi, I'm Jessica. My mother stayed at home all day to raise me and my siblings, my father used to be an insurance salesman, I graduated valedictorian of my high school class, I had to drop out of college to help with my grandparents, and I cannot stand salads.
That's cool. How did you feel about having a stay-at-home mom?
I loved it. She was always there for me and my siblings.
That's awesome. What was your favorite thing about your father's job as an insurance salesman?
He was always so good at talking to people and making them feel comfortable.
That's a great skill to have. Were you happy to graduate valedictorian of your high school class?
I was so proud of myself! It was a lot of hard work, but it was worth it.
I bet it was. I'm sorry you had to drop out of college. What made you have to do that?
My grandparents got sick and I had to help take care of them.
Oh, that's tough. I'm sure that was hard on you.
It was, but I'm glad I could be there for them.
That's good. I'm sorry you don't like salads. I love them!
I know, it's weird. I just can't stand the taste of them.
That's okay. Everyone has their own preferences.
